benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/emails - Add account email

covered: Valid Payload: Successful creation of email (TC01)
Invalid Payload: Various malformed or missing fields (TC07, TC08, TC10, TC11, TC12, TC13, TC14, TC15, TC16, TC17, TC18)
Large Payloads: Tested with maximum field sizes (TC16)
Validation: Email format validation (TC12) and required fields validation (TC11)
Successful addition scenarios: with/without existing emails, optional headers, required headers only (TC01, TC03, TC04, TC20, TC05, TC02)
Error handling: invalid accountId format (TC07), missing accountId (TC08), non‑existent account (TC09), unauthorized access (TC14), external service unavailable (TC15)
Security: SQL injection (TC23) and XSS attempts (TC24)
Integration consistency: verification via GET after POST (TC26)
Recovery: retry after transient network failure (TC25)
gaps: Duplicate Submission: No test for adding the same email address twice or handling duplicate email entries
Server Error Handling: No test for 500 Internal Server Error from database or internal failures
Rate Limiting: No test for throttling or rate limit behavior on POST endpoint
Idempotency: No test to verify idempotent behavior of repeated identical requests
Email length limit: No test for maximum email length boundary
Email uniqueness across accounts: Not covered
recommendations: Add a test case for duplicate email submission to verify proper handling of duplicate entries
Add a test that simulating a database failure resulting in a 500 Internal Server Error
Add rate limiting tests to ensure the API enforces throttling on excessive POST requests
Add an idempotency test to verify that repeated identical POST requests behave as expected
Add tests for email address length limits to verify boundary handling
Add tests to confirm email uniqueness constraints across accounts
